title: George Piktuzis
text:
George Richard Piktuzis (January 3, 1932 – November 28, 1993) was an American <a href="professional%20baseball">professional baseball</a> player, a left-handed <a href="pitcher">pitcher</a> who appeared as a <a href="relief%20pitcher">relief pitcher</a> in two <a href="games%20played">games</a> for the <a href="Chicago%20Cubs">Chicago Cubs</a> of <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a>. The native of <a href="Chicago">Chicago</a> batted right-handed, stood tall and weighed .
Piktuzis' professional career lasted six seasons (1950–52; 1955–57). His MLB appearances came in April 1956 against the <a href="St.%20Louis%20Cardinals">St. Louis Cardinals</a> and <a href="Cincinnati%20Redlegs">Cincinnati Redlegs</a>. He surrendered four <a href="earned%20runs">earned runs</a> and six <a href="hit%20%28baseball%29">hits</a>, including a <a href="home%20run">home run</a> by Cincinnati's <a href="George%20Crowe">George Crowe</a>, in five <a href="innings%20pitched">innings pitched</a>. As a <a href="minor%20league%20baseball">minor leaguer</a>, he compiled a 34–62 (.354) record in 176 games.
George Piktuzis died in <a href="Long%20Beach%2C%20California">Long Beach, California</a>, at the age of 61.
